pageContext.desc: Written from the Oklahoma Territory, the Southwest, and the Dakotas, regarding his commissioned series of portraits of prominent Indian Chiefs.
transcription:
Rosebud, S. Dak.
May 22 1903
My dear Uncle
I will send you Tomorrow
twenty six nd drawings, some of the
heads there are three and four but
different positions. I have got 
twenty oil portraits finished. I have
not been working too hard.
Chief Sorrel Horse is sitting for one
now he has the reputation of stealing
more horses from other tribes of Indian than any Indian he like very much
to tell about it.
I will send the oil portraits to
my Father as he has a lot of my
Indian frames and he can just as
well frame them for me.
I hardly know what my plans
pageContext.category: Edward E. Ayer Manuscript Collection; Indians of North America; Letters (Correspondence)
pageContext.title: E.A. Burbank letters, 1903-1905
